text: here for the moment remember the boy who
was picked up by the interns in Syria
can you please go get him and bring you
into our home park in the driveway or on
the street I won't be waiting for you
guys with flags flowers I move we will
give him my family you'll be our brother
Kevin my little sister will be Clark
thinks butterflies the fireplace for him
in my school I have a friend from Syria
and I will introduce him to all more and
we can all play together we can invite
him to birthday parties and he will
teach us another language say one thing
boys who doesn't have doors
captain will share her bed full of
rubber boy bunny and I will share my
I won't eat him
I will teach I will teach him some dish
and hand subtraction those are the words
of a six-year-old boy
he teaches us a lot the humanity that a
young child can display who hasn't
learned to be cynical more suspicious or
fearful of other people because of where
they're from or how they look or how
they pray we can all learn from Alex
Alex six years old
